description: About The Team  After acquiring our digital banking licence, ShopeePay is now expanding its presence in the Singapore market aggressively.  We are not only looking at providing another popular payment solution for the merchants and customers, but also striving to build an ecosystem via ShopeePay.  Within this ecosystem, merchants can market their products & services more cost-effectively, hence better attract customers to their offline outlets. At the same time, customers are able to enjoy a variety of good-valued deals too.  Job Description Collaborate with Sales Leaders on driving key business objectives Responsible for incentives and KPI setting, headcount planning and development of future strategies Business performance evaluation Produce weekly/monthly operational reports for Sales Team and Sales Management Produce ad hoc reports/analysis for Sales Leadership team Initiate BD Projects that help our sales teams perform better Uncover and implement policies and processes to increase productivity, efficiency, and accuracy within our sales teams Lead Generation  Requirements Good university degree 1-3 years of experience in a Sales Operations / Sales Analyst / Business Analyst / Consulting role Experience assessing Sales Capacity and developing Sales KPI as well as corresponding Incentive Plans

The Sales Operations Coordinator provides logistical and liaising assistance to support the commercial needs of Kendo business in Southeast Asia. This position will work very closely with the Brand Planning and Inventory Manager to ensure timely processing and accurate delivery of customer purchase orders and returns. S/he is also tasked to generate sales and performance reports and analyses needed by all Kendo brands in the region.  This role is an entry-level role ideal for new graduates or those with limited experience who would like to grow a career in beauty retail.

At Talkwalker, our Sales team is responsible to attract, nurture and close business opportunities generated from both inbound, outbound and partner activities. They are responsible to connect with prospective clients to introduce them to Talkwalker and demonstrate the value of our analytics platform throughout the Marketing, Communications and Insights departments.  Talkwalker is a leading social listening & analytics company with over 2,000 clients globally. Through our AI-powered analytics platform, we gather data from the conversations that happen around brands - online, in the media, and within companies themselves - to uncover, understand, and action consumer insights. We are extremely international, with headquarters in Luxembourg and offices in New York City, San Francisco, Frankfurt, Paris, Singapore, and Tokyo.  Key Responsibilities:  Effectively communicate Talkwalker’s vision to potential prospects in a well organized, thoughtful approach Generate new business opportunities through outbound prospecting via phone calls, emails, and LinkedIn with support from our world-class marketing team Work in tandem with Account Executives to help them identify and develop opportunities within their defined territories Manage pipeline and outreach via CRM and Sales Automation tools Bring a positive attitude to our team on a daily basis   Qualifications:  1+ year of sales or SDR experience, SaaS experience preferred A verifiable history of exceeding personal targets Excellent verbal and written communication skills A sense of accountability and commitment to attain goals The ability to perform day to day tasks with minimal supervision  Strong work ethic  What we offer:  20 days of vacation International health insurance Competitive base salary and opportunity for bonus Internal growth and development programs Company events such as social activities 1 volunteering day per year

If you believe in delighting customers, have high standards and are resourceful, we want to hear from you.  You will Support and develop the growth strategy for the team and manage day-to-day sales operations. Be accountable for increasing revenue, new client acquisition and/or existing account growth. Assist in developing an effective sales training program. Effectively work cross-functionally to shape the product roadmap based on data-driven insights. Assist in refining the company’s sales strategy and processes. Assist the sales and operational teams to implement best industry practices and knowledge. Provide on-site client support for major accounts/events. We’re looking for someone with Experience in outbound sales - more than 1 year’s experience in catering or hospitality sales preferred. Best in class customer service. Strong management and communication skills. Intellectual curiosity. Ability to start and get things done. Ability to handle ambiguity. What’s In It For You Work with a fast growing, at the same time, lean and mean team, to make real world impact. Have a lot of ownership and drive your own results and progression. Smart people who sweat the details and push for the highest standards. Training, mentorship, buddies, in-house university program to help you grow. Other benefits include competitive compensation package, health care, clubs, birthday leave and a lot of fun events. You should include these in your application Resume or LinkedIn profile Tell us about a time where you had to work on a task that seemed to be extremely challenging, and how you overcame it? What are your favourite projects? What motivates you? What is something you believe that nearly no one agrees with you on?

Implement and coordinate the operational aspects of ongoing Channel Sales projects and activities. You will serve as liaison between Channel Sales Leadership, Marketing and Distributors. You will review status of projects and budgets. You will coordinate schedules and deliver status reports. You will assess project issues and develop resolutions to meet productivity, quality, and customers satisfaction goals and objectives. You will develop mechanisms for monitoring Channel Sales progress and for problem solving with project managers and customers  Key Responsibilities Channel Sales Activities Manage Projects Provide Customer Support Facilitate Team Alignment Deliver Status Reports Manage Teams YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree, or equivalent. Some experience in the field. Valid Drivers' License WE VALUE A proficient understanding of the principles and best practices in Channel Sales Excellent team and communication skills An ability to take initiative and work with limited direction An ability to influence across a broader organization Masters Degree Additional Information JOB ID: HRD127583 Category: Sales Location: 17 Changi Business Park Central 1,U01-01/09, #02-01/09, #03-01/09, #04-01/09 & #05-01/05,Singapore,SINGAPORE,486073,Singapore Exempt

description: About Tetrate  Tetrate is a leading enterprise service mesh company that enables customers to have a safe and fast application modernization journey. Its founding team represents creators and key maintainers of Envoy and Istio open-source projects. As a fast-growing startup serving Fortune 500 Companies, we are defining the next generation of network, authorization, and security.  What You’ll Do Collaborate with sales, marketing, and partner team to develop new strategies to build our sales pipeline and grow our business Balance the reactive work of responding to interested users with a creative and proactive approach to identify new business opportunities Use Hubspot, Linkedin, ZoomInfo, and other prospecting tools to research accounts, identify key contacts and craft targeted messaging to increase customer interest and excitement around Tetrate products Learn our technology and effectively communicate Tetrate’s value proposition with a technical audience. Work to understand their goals and challenges to better understand how we can help Engage in team development and mentoring Consistently meet (and exceed!) clearly defined monthly targets  What You Bring Along 0-2 years of sales or related experience High integrity and a team-first mentality Strong ability to work autonomously Open to feedback, genuinely curious and constantly looking for ways to learn & improve Genuine interest and excitement for Tetrate’s technology  Experience working with a technical product or the aptitude to quickly learn complex technical concepts Fearless approach to prospecting -- phone skills, excellent listening skills, and strong writing skills are all important Team-oriented and willing to help others Hubspot and other sales tools experience is a plus  Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, we welcome a wide range of backgrounds and levels of experience. If you’re interested, we’d love to hear from you!   Location: Worldwide - Remote, to be able to work in APAC time zone

Coinbase has built the world's leading compliant cryptocurrency platform serving over 30 million accounts in more than 100 countries. With multiple successful products, and our vocal advocacy for blockchain technology, we have played a major part in mainstream awareness and adoption of cryptocurrency. We are proud to offer an entire suite of products that are helping build the cryptoeconomy and increase economic freedom around the world.  There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for signals that a candidate will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, disrupt ourselves, and expect sustained high performance because we play as a championship team. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people with the desire and capacity to build and share expertise in the frontier technologies of crypto and blockchain, in whatever way is most relevant to their role.  As an Account Manager, Client Services, you’ll join a high functioning team of passionate support professionals whose performance is critical to Coinbase achieving its mission. You will serve as a primary subject matter expert for Coinbase’s institutional suite of products (Prime Broker and Custody), providing world-class service and support to our most valued institutional clients such as hedge funds, investment managers, market makers, and private wealth managers. Diligent, empathetic, and have a bias towards action, you will play a crucial role in the success of the Client Services organization as we help build the cryptoeconomy.  What You'll Be Doing (i.e., Job Duties) Serve as the primary account manager for a group of Coinbase’s highest value institutional clients, co-owning the relationship with our Institutional Coverage sales teams from top of funnel through on platform support Build and maintain strong relationships with new and existing Coinbase institutional clients, driving successful integrations with the institutional product suite and impact to the overall business Provide a best in class experience for our clients through effective stakeholder management, decisive prioritization, and efficient execution across institutional teams Understand complex, multi-product client workflows and strategies to ensure that our institutional clients are integrated appropriately and using our product suite optimally Effectively triage, manage and prioritize incoming client requests. Manage requests through to resolution, including delegating across teams of subject matter experts Facilitate prospect and client demo calls, serving as subject matter expert on product features, answering technical cryptocurrency related questions, and demonstrating how Coinbase can fit into their overall strategy Distill client feedback to internal teams including Advocacy, Engineering and Product when surfacing bugs, incidents, and product feedback What We Look For In You (ie. Job Requirements) Motivated by Coinbase’s mission and creating a seamless, white-glove support experience for our highest value individual and institutional clients Experience managing relationships with Market Makers and Introducing Brokers and working with Engineering and Product teams. Minimum of 6 years of relevant experience in an institutional client partner / services / advisory role in financial services or technology industry Experience with relationship or account management for institutional clients, liaising with executive leadership, management, and/or senior operations contacts In depth knowledge of global financial markets, prime brokerage, margin, lending, derivatives, trading platforms, custody, and/or crypto Experience with different channels of support, including voice, e-mail and/or chat Fantastic communication skills in order to operate across multiple departments, stakeholders, and clients Flexible and adaptable to meet the evolving needs of a high-growth and fast paced organization Travel requirements up to 20% to Coinbase offices and client locations (depending on business need) Nice To Haves High level of proficiency in cryptocurrency and Coinbase products Advanced degree in business, finance, project management or client experience ID: G1774  Commitment to Equal Opportunity  Coinbase is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected by applicable law. Coinbase will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. For US applicants, you may view Pay Transparency, Employee Rights and Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law notices by clicking on their corresponding links. Additionally, Coinbase participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.  Coinbase is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@ coinbase.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. For quick access to screen reading technology compatible with this site click here to download a free compatible screen reader (free step by step tutorial can be found here). Please contact accommodations@ coinbase.com for additional information or to request accommodations.  Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants  Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. Our full notice outlining how data will be processed as part of the application procedure for applicable locations is available here: Ireland/EU, United Kingdom, and California. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required.

description: Coursera was launched in 2012 by two Stanford Computer Science professors, Andrew Ng and Daphne Koller, with a mission to provide universal access to world-class learning. It is now one of the largest online learning platforms in the world, with 87 million registered learners as of June 30, 2021. Coursera partners with over 200 leading university and industry partners to offer a broad catalog of content and credentials, including Guided Projects, courses, Specializations, certificates, and bachelor’s and master’s degrees. Institutions around the world use Coursera to upskill and reskill their employees, citizens, and students in many high-demand fields, including data science, technology, and business. Coursera became a B Corp in February 2021.  Job Overview  The Sales Development Team is a critical component of our growth plan. All inbound and outbound engagement with prospective customers starts with the SDR team. As a Outbound Sales Development Representative (SDR), you will be responsible for generating interest in Coursera by contacting prospects, presenting our solutions, and qualifying leads for our sales team. You will work closely with sales and marketing teams to ensure we operate as a seamless organization to build our pipeline of business.  The ideal individual will have experience with enterprise sales/partnerships and be interested in working for a social enterprise. Your knowledge of Edtech, and enterprise learning combined with superior communication skills and analytical abilities, will shape Coursera’s B2B business to help us provide more access to education globally.  Responsibilities Build a pipeline of leads for the sales team by qualifying inbound inquiries and reaching out to high-potential prospects Conduct effective discovery and qualification conversations with prospects through your deep understanding of our product value proposition and use cases Develop creative strategies for engaging and nurturing prospects using content, email, phone, social media and any other strategies that work Partner closely with members of the sales and marketing teams to coordinate engagement strategies and improving processes Use your frontline knowledge of customer needs to educate the broader team on learnings and opportunities Basic Qualifications A graduate degree or professional experience of 2+ years Preferred Qualifications Excellent written and verbal communications and listening skills Experience selling or marketing software or services and meeting a quota Entrepreneurial drive and comfort working in ambiguous, quickly-changing environments Experience with sales and or marketing tools such as Salesforce, Outreach, DiscoverOrg, Lusha Post-Graduate degree, preferred If this opportunity interests you, you might like these courses on Coursera:  Successful Negotiation: Essential Strategies and Skills  Connecting with Sales Prospects  Work Smarter, Not Harder: Time Management for Personal & Professional  Coursera is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and considers all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected class.  If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, please contact us at accommodations@coursera.org.  Please review our CCPA Applicant Notice here.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Experience: 3+ years  Job Purpose  This role exists to manage the Sales Development/Lead Generation operations in Singapore. The role has ownership of generating and converting pipeline of customer for Anchanto's products.  Description  Sales Development Representative, Singapore  As a Sales Development Representative for Anchanto's products (OMS and WMS) focused on Enterprise segment, you will have the exciting opportunity to help promote the growth and shape the future of SaaS products for eCommerce players in the Retail and Logistics sector.  The ideal candidate will possess both business development and technical background that enables them to engage at with C-level executives as well as with software developers and IT architects. They should also be a self-starter, prepared to develop and execute to increase market penetration across Singapore.  Roles & Responsibilities Impact market share in the Singapore territory or industry vertical. Direct sales Development for software sales to enterprises (Brand Principals, Distributors, 3PLs, Warehousing Companies, E-distributors, Retailers) to build strong B2B SaaS business in Singapore Lead generation for a funnel pipeline: Manage entire sales cycle (as individual contributor) steps such as cold call, LinkedIn emails, personal networking etc Understand Customers' current Business and Operational processes to propose the right fit of SaaS products, Understanding the customer pain points, Map to Solutioning Demoing the Product/Solution : Product introduction SaaS platform demonstration, explanation of technical and functional capabilities, Understand and consult on a strategic and business level, available integrations and flows Assist with Contract Closure: follow-up call, sharing updates and assisting with proposal, pricing negotiation, contract signing, on-boarding and account handover to global account management teams Structured and organised to manage and update the CRM tool for effective Sales Pipeline management Business and Commercial Skills: Possess the technical ability to explain (not implement) Cloud/SaaS Solutions, Integrations, Retail, Omni-channel and eCommerce Fulfilment flows. Create & articulate compelling value propositions around Retail Solutions. Understanding of Value Based Selling and translate it into Commercial Agreements Work closely with the internal marketing team, PR team and top management to swiftly pickup lead/enquires / suspects to be put in sales processes. Other Skills: Proactive to source leads from partners, own research and other channels. Demonstrable research skills along with excellent Listening skills Self-starter and should be able to proceed with minimal supervision Excellent Verbal and written communication skills in English. Understanding and respect multi-cultural work environment Constantly give feedback to marketing on lead and funnel quality and re-align to target relevant segment Compile reports for management showing results (ROI) reports on customer needs, problems, interests, competitive activities, and potential for new products and services. Keep abreast of best practices and promotional trends for our products target segments Keep track of competition, pricing and promotions being offered by the competition in the market Exceed set business objectives. Work with partners (referrers, Sis, consultants, government agencies etc) to extend reach & drive adoption. Basic Qualifications: Ability to generate qualified leads and excellent cold calling skills to engage accounts The right person will possess 1-2 years of experience in B2B lead generation (IT and SaaS preferable) Prior experience in a revenue target holding role is absolutely necessity Direct field & management experience in working with corporate accounts. Would have consistently exceeded key performance metrics. Demonstrated ability to engage and influence C-level executives. Strong presentation skills and the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross-functional audiences. Excellent written, and verbal communication skills, data analysis and presentation skills in English. Experience with E-commerce Sellers, Brands and Retailer in Singapore is an added advantage Ability to work with the global team in different geographies, cultures and time zones to solve customer problems and escalate as necessary  Scope of the Role The role will have geographical coverage of Singapore

description: The Future Is What We Make It  Senior Sales Manager  Singapore  Honeywell offers employees the opportunity to work on the world’s most exciting projects, redefining the cities we live in, the buildings where we work, and the vehicles that move us.  We are currently seeking a Senior Sales Manager to join our Building Technologies (HBT) team in our Singapore office. Reporting to a Product Sales Leader, your focus will be oversight of new prospects and maintain existing customers to drive sales; Facilitating connection between channel partners, M&E Contractors, M&E consultants, architects, developers and users for specifications; assessing market intelligence support and covering the developments going into the market place by competitors and their pricing.  Responsibilities  Drive product sales that bring together both hardware and software products add value to the team with your expertise by driving ideas for new products, principles, theories and concepts. Help Honeywell be the customer's top choice by improving upon Product Sales solutions. Responsible for the market development and growth of HBT business in Singapore. This includes identifying & appointing key customers (Developers / Architects / Interior Designers / M&E Contractors) to increase pipeline. Manage the business and the existing customers to grow the HBT business. Understand the local markets and identify opportunities where our businesses can succeed with current offerings in all relevant market verticals especially Residential, Commercial, Leisure & Entertainment Hospitality, and Healthcare. Develop and execute an overall business plan to achieve the growth targets set for the business in terms of Revenue and margin expansion. Coordinate sales opportunities with the correct engineering and product deliverable. Undertake regular consultant/customer visits for ongoing product and sales training, joint sales calls, and open project reviews Manage any channel/M&E contractors conflict that may arise Evaluating competitors in the local market Establishing and owning the plans and strategies aimed at serving and expanding the customer base Responsible for the strategy and execution of the sales plan for a specific system and vertical market. Accurate forecast of revenue and growth opportunities You Must Have 3 to 5 years’ experience in Project related sales background (Electrical and building management systems knowledge) Bachelor's degree, or equivalent Project / Product Sales Experience Proven track record preferably within the building solutions industry preferred. Excellent written and oral presentation skills. Ability to present and communicate complex technical solutions clearly at all business levels. Ability to work in diverse cultural and multi lingual environments. Proactive mindset and able to work efficiently within virtual and distributed teams We Value A proficient understanding of the principles and best practices in Product / Project Sales Excellent team and communication skills An ability to take initiative and work with limited direction An ability to influence across a broader organization About Us  The world is changing. And it’s a familiar story at Honeywell. Our $36 billion business was founded on a legacy of firsts spanning 130 years. We’re building a safer, smarter, and more sustainable world through our technology and software across each of our 930 sites globally. Our impact is seen in every shape and size around the world. Our solutions are felt daily in aerospace, buildings and cities, retail, chemicals and materials, safety, industrial and manufacturing, safety, and supply chains.  Discover More  We’ve been innovating for more than 100 years and now we’re creating what’s next. There’s a lot more available for you to discover. Our solutions, our case studies, our #futureshapers, and so much more. Learn more at careers.honeywell.com/us/en/  If you believe what happens tomorrow is determined by what we do today, you’ll love working at Honeywell.  The future is what we make it. So join us and let’s do this together.  Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.  For more information on applicable equal employment regulations, refer to the EEO is the Law poster.  Please refer to the EEO is the Law Supplement Poster & the Pay Transparency Policy .  For more information on how we process your information in the job application process, please refer to Recruitment Privacy Notice.  If a disability prevents you from applying for a job through our website, request assistance here. No other requests will be acknowledged.  Copyright © 2020 Honeywell International Inc  Additional Information JOB ID: HRD123493 Category: Sales Location: 17 Changi Business Park Central 1,U01-01/09, #02-01/09, #03-01/09, #04-01/09 & #05-01/05,Singapore,SINGAPORE,486073,Singapore Exempt

description: Optimizely is focused on unlocking digital potential and we are the recognized category leader in Digital Experience Platform (DXP) and created the category for A/B Testing and experimentation software. We have incredible customers - isn’t that one of the most important aspects of looking for your next job? Optimizely has over 9,000 brands from global organizations such as Visa, Sky, Yamaha, Wall Street Journal to tech innovators like Atlassian, DocuSign, FitBit and Zillow.  Not only are we financially sound and growing but we have unicorn status: Exceeded $300M in revenue in 2020, is profitable already, and has all strategic options ahead of itself. Optimizely continues to invest and addresses a market opportunity north of $30 billion, providing significant personal career growth opportunities.  We are an inclusive culture with a global team of 1200+ people across the US, Europe, Australia, and Vietnam. We blend European and American business culture with emphasis on teamwork, inclusion, and moving fast. People make the difference!  If you are looking to work on the next generation of digital technologies in a fast-paced, hyper-growth environment, apply! We’re just getting started...  What's it like to work here?  "Nowhere else in the tech industry can you find a role that puts you on the frontlines of digital transformation, speaking with the world's most exciting brands to help them build the online experiences of the future. As a bonus, we let loose with fun outings to awesome restaurants and activities." - Henry, Current Account Executive, former SDR  What You'll Do Help us bring the world’s most adopted digital experimentation platform to your assigned markets Become part of our proud front-line as the first touch-point for clients, establishing long-term relationships Collaborate with Account Executives and Marketing to further develop the territories Drive targeted customer engagements with senior marketing executives Educate businesses on the value of testing and personalization through experimentation Become a specialist in SaaS solutions sales Be part of an intercultural environment with inspiring and ambitious colleagues Great support for personal development and mentorship Qualifications Sales experience, customer service experience or another type of client-facing experience preferred Knowledge from and insights in tech/SaaS business is preferred You take ownership of everything you do You love making a direct impact You are a keen communicator and love to meet new people You are passionate about technology and online business You are a self-starter with a growth mindset You are solutions-oriented and not afraid to speak up or share an idea You are fluent in verbal and written English Even if you meet 60% of these qualifications, we encourage you to apply! We are looking to create a diverse and multifaceted team. We embody inclusion, which is reflected in our company values where we embrace diversity and equal opportunities for everyone.  Optimizely is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Optimizely is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Foursquare is the leading independent location technology company, powered by our deep understanding of how people move throughout the world. Our solutions help businesses make smarter decisions, developers create more engaging experiences, and brands build more effective marketing strategies.  Foursquare’s platform includes Attribution, Audience, Proximity, Places, Pilgrim SDK and Visits. As the industry’s first and only accredited company for location data from the Media Rating Council (MRC), this foundation powers all our solutions — those that exist today and those we have yet to build. Over 14 billion consumer-verified place visit confirmations help us keep our map and models fresh and up-to-date, building a phone’s-eye-view of the world with 105 million unique places of interest worldwide.  About The Role  As the Sales Manager you will be responsible for a defined set of independent agencies and brands. The position requires a strategic thinker who will be deeply involved in creating location-based advertising solutions for advertisers that lead to strategic and long term partnerships.  Responsibilities You will spend time meeting with agencies and brand direct clients, evangelizing Foursquare and location-powered advertising. You will be responsible for building positive relationships with client/agency counterparts, maintaining ongoing communications and ensuring that client needs are met. Along with the Business Development, Product, and Data teams you will craft custom opportunities to address marketer’s goals. You will take complex, and at times technical, sets of capabilities and translate that into a compelling story for the marketplace. You will maintain a high level of internal and external client service orientation while providing excellent customer service. Tracks all activity in Salesforce and manages/closes opportunities in a timely fashion. Qualifications 7+ years of experience with digital advertising in sales, account management, programmatic or data led sales experience preferred. Has a network of contacts throughout the industry at both agencies and clients. An entrepreneurial approach to business Demonstrated success in a goal oriented, highly accountable sales environment. Strong work ethic with excellent organizational, project/time management, and analytical skills Experience structuring, negotiating and closing large partnership deals with top holding companies Experience using Excel, Powerpoint, Salesforce, Google Docs Ability to think and plan strategically BS/BA degree Foursquare is proud to foster an inclusive environment that is free from discrimination. We strongly believe in order to build the best products, we need a diversity of perspectives and backgrounds. This leads to a more delightful experience for our users and team members. We value listening to every voice and we encourage everyone to come be a part of building a company and products we love.  Foursquare is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

description: Available for the following locations: Remote | Sydney, Australia | Singapore, Singapore  Hello, We're TechnologyAdvice.  At TechnologyAdvice, we are dedicated to educating, advising, and connecting buyers and sellers of business technology. As a trusted resource across hundreds of technology verticals, our unbiased research and crowd-sourced product reviews help buyers find the right software to grow their business.  TechnologyAdvice has been named as one of the Inc. 5000 list of America’s Fastest-Growing Private Companies four times, as well as inclusion in the Inc Best Workplaces list for 2021. In 2019, TechnologyAdvice received a Nashville Business Journal Small Business Award and was named the Market Mover in the Nashville Chamber’s NEXT Awards. We are also a five-time recipient of the annual Tennessee Top Workplaces awards.  TechnologyAdvice is based in Nashville, Tenn, with a diverse workforce and client base located across the globe. We’re growing and always interested in expanding our team with top talent...make sure to check out our perks and benefits listed below!  The Opportunity…  We are seeking a highly motivated individual, with a passion for sales and marketing! If you have previous experience in customer service, enjoy networking, and have a high competitive drive, we would love for you to apply! The Sales Development Rep’s main objectives are to identify new prospects and help the sales team exceed revenue targets by creating sales meetings and opportunities. The SDR is often the first point of contact our clients have and will be the first experience the customer has with TA. Using a consultative approach, the Sales Development Rep is to uncover customer needs, introduce TA’s solutions and connect prospective customers with the appropriate Sales Lead.  How You'll Contribute… Create engaging videos, emails and LinkedIn messages to help break through the noise Respond, engage, and qualify leads and inquiries from technologyadvice.com/partners Exceed daily client engagement goals through phone, email, and social media touches Cold prospect and find new contacts and accounts Create and articulate compelling value propositions around TA offerings Establish effective outreach cadences and cold calling tactics/strategies Communicate with prospects and coordinate their calendars with the AE who will be taking the call Work with the Sales leaders to pass off opportunities What You Bring…  We're looking for someone who's hungry to learn and can do so quickly, while also bringing new ideas and creativity to the team. Bonus points if you're technical enough to already know your way around Salesforce, Salesloft, or another CRM platform! Some other things about you include: Excellent communication and presentation skills Fast learner and passion for sales Self-motivated with a results-driven approach Enthusiastic and outgoing conversation skills A confident and determined outlook Resilience - the ability to cope with rejection Competitive mentality Being coachable is a must Why You Want Us... MacBook Pro or PC laptop, your choice Ongoing Career Development Meetings Subscription to the Headspace App Monthly Team Outings and Quarterly Volunteer Opportunities Professional development opportunities and incentives Milestone celebrations for birthdays, weddings, work achievements, and more Employer sponsored medical and dental options Comprehensive life insurance and disability programs Long Service Award, a thank you to our employees for their service To see all job openings and learn more, visit our.  Interviews will take place after resumes have been screened for minimum requirements. Please note that this position is not restricted solely to the responsibilities listed above and that the job scope and responsibilities are subject to change.  We believe that our differences make us stronger and foster a diverse and inclusive culture where people feel safe being themselves. TechnologyAdvice is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law.  Pre-employment screening required.  COVID-19 RESPONSE:  TechnologyAdvice is committed to the safety and wellness of each of our employees. In response to the COVID-19 Pandemic, we follow all CDC and local protocol.  Powered by JazzHR  Sma8mGkr3X

description: Suggestr is one of the fastest-growing product recommendations solutions for Shopify stores, backed by Entrepreneur First and leading angel investors in the e-commerce space.  We bring Facebook-quality product recommendations for DTC brands on Shopify, enabling them to increase store-wide conversion rates by up to 19%.  We are looking for an energetic self-starter with the ability to communicate clearly with influence to lead product demos for inbound interests, build rapport, and establish long-term relationships.   Responsibilities Update and manage all sales activities, opportunities, and account information in CRM Consistently achieve monthly quota of qualified opportunities Qualify prospects on calls and conduct sales presentations (some calls maybe in PST daytime)  Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Business or a related field At least 1 prior sales experience (internships are acceptable) Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize work

About the team  This tight-knit and growing team is dedicated to the future of work.  The leadership team have cut their teeth in hyper-growth startups, the military, and academia.  The sales team you will be joining is led by two leaders who have been founding salespeople at unicorns and startups acquired for 9+ figures.  They make outsized investments in career development, craft a caring environment, and hold each other to exceptionally high standards.  Sales Development Representative - APAC - Fully Remote  You will be joining an early stage, rapidly growing start-up where the sales function is somewhat undefined. You won’t just come in and plug into a well-oiled sales machine - You will be helping to build it. In addition, you’ll do all the usual stuff an SDR in a SaaS style startup does.  Which, to be clear looks like this:  Lead generation through a mix of LinkedIn, prospecting and cold outreach (email and calls). Keep information up-to-date in the CRM of all sales processes. Use your creative flair to help develop new processes and improve outbound prospecting. Focus on the customer to gather feedback for the product and service teams.  You're the type of person that...  Is ambitious, strategic, and passionate about sales Is not afraid of rejection and is comfortable making calls to prospects Can build strong relationships has solid rapport building skills Has experience creating urgency and educating on a value proposition Is a team player who wants to be part of a fast-growing startup  What's in it for you...  Training and coaching from leaders in SaaS Share options 30+ days annual vacation entitlement including local holidays Flexible working - work from anywhere in the world Company retreats - company-wide retreats post COVID and lots of socials/team building trips  Apply now!

description: About Aspire: Aspire is the #1 All-in-one financial operating platform for businesses in Southeast Asia. With a mission to reinvent banking for a new generation of entrepreneurs and business owners, Aspire is building a platform that offers what financial products our customers need, how they need it.  Founded in 2018 by former Lazada founders and executives, Aspire has successfully raised USD 40M from world-class investors and financial partners such as Y-combinator and others. It has partnered with leading financial firms like Visa and Wise to power its solutions. In 2020, we were awarded as the #1 Hottest Startup by Singapore Business Review and Startup Award by TechNode Global ORIGIN Awards. Currently, we have ~200 employees across offices in Singapore, Indonesia, Vietnam, Thailand.  You will be amazed and energized by the diverse backgrounds of our people. We are a team made up of ex-entrepreneurs, ex-founders and high-achievers who want to make an impact yet always collaborate and don’t take NO for an answer. We have high bars during our recruitment process because we want to inspire and to be inspired by our teammates.    We are still expanding and hiring more top talents who are passionate about startups to join the journey of building a Neobank to support the under-serviced SMEs and entrepreneurs.  About the Role: As a Sales Development Representative (Commercial Card/FX), you will be reporting to the Sales Manager. At Aspire, we divide our Growth Team into 3: Business Development - Sales - Account Management. Your mission will be to close as many in/outbound leads as possible and ensure they fully utilize their account.    What will you be doing?  Hunt startups in APAC that are raising capital and who are in need of an account to receive funding Perform prospecting activities such as cold calling and networking Manage and maintain a pipeline of interested prospects and engage sales executives for next steps Drive referrals by your exceptional work  Identify best practices to refine the company’s lead generation playbook Keep all records in our CRM  Report to Sales Manager with weekly, monthly, and quarterly results  We would love to get to know you if you have the following:  Bachelor’s degree OR at least 2-3 years of relevant work experience Hunting new opportunities is in your blood  Possess a track record of being a top producer in your previous companies  Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment Strong communication skills via phone (cold calling) and email Experience with a card provider (Amex/Visa/MasterCard/CardUp) is a big plus (Commercial Card) & knowledge of the commercial card market in Singapore (and SEA ideally)  OR Experience with a remittance company (WorldFirst/Wise/Instarem/Wallex/SingX) is a big plus (FX) Strong desire and ability to move up within a sales organization  As a part of the application process, candidates need to submit this Application form: https://forms.gle/PYxdYWvtPpqgsbU66

Improve business and family comfort, protection and productivity  Oversee new prospects and maintain existing customers to drive sales. Facilitate connection between channel partners, M&E Contractors, M&E consultants, architects, developers and users for specifications. Assess market intelligence support covering the developments going into the market place by competitors and their pricing.  Drive product sales that bring together both hardware and software products add value to the team with your expertise by driving ideas for new products, principles, theories and concepts. Help Honeywell be the customer's top choice by improving upon Product Sales solutions Work closely with the Sales Leader for the market development and growth of the Fire business in Singapore. This includes identifying & appointing key customers (Developers / Architects / Interior Designers / M&E Contractors) to increase pipeline. Manage the Fire business and the existing and new customers to grow the HBT business. Understand the local markets and identify opportunities where our businesses can succeed with current offerings in all relevant market verticals especially Residential, Data Center,Commercial, Leisure & Entertainment Hospitality, and Healthcare. Develop and execute an overall business plan with the team to achieve the growth targets set for the business in terms of Revenue and margin expansion. Coordinate sales opportunities with the correct engineering and product deliverable. Undertake regular consultant/customer visits for ongoing product and sales training, joint sales calls, and open project reviews Manage any channel/M&E contractors conflict that may arise Evaluating competitors in the local market Have the ability to execute the plans and strategies aimed at serving and expanding the customer base Accurate forecast of revenue and growth opportunities YOU MUST HAVE 3 to 5 years’ experience in Project related sales background (Fire Alarms, Public Address and Voice Evacuation Systems, Fire Suppression Systems). Bachelor's degree, or equivalent Service/ Project / Product Sales Experience would be beneficial Excellent written and oral presentation skills. Ability to present and communicate complex technical solutions clearly at all business levels. Ability to work in diverse cultural and multi lingual environments. Proactive mindset and able to work efficiently within virtual and distributed teams WE VALUE A proficient understanding of the principles and best practices in Product/ Project Sales Excellent team and communication skills An ability to take initiative and work with limited direction An ability to influence across a broader organization Additional Information JOB ID: HRD132303 Category: Sales Location: 17 Changi Business Park Central 1,U01-01/09, #02-01/09, #03-01/09, #04-01/09 & #05-01/05,Singapore,SINGAPORE,486073,Singapore Exempt Sales (HBT)

description: This role will primarily be responsible in supporting Morning’s B2B sales directives from qualifying and closing leads. The candidate will work closely with Morning’s sales team to hit the B2B/wholesale targets. The candidate is expected to liaise directly with internal teams, prospective sales leads and customers.  As part of the role, the candidate will be assigned to look after regional markets as part of the company’s go-to-market strategy. The preferred location is in Singapore but remote work can be considered.   Responsibilities: Work closely with the sales team to hit monthly sales targets. Generate new prospects for each market and follow-up accordingly. Craft compelling sales pitches and proposals for prospective customers. Give feedback to the sales team based on discussion with prospective and existing customers. Assist in producing monthly reports of the sales progress. Establish, develop and maintain positive business and customer relationships. Expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints to maximise satisfaction and close a sale. Coordinate sales effort with team members and other departments such as Operations and Marketing. Prepare Distribution Agreements and Price List for prospective customers. Focuses sales efforts by studying existing and potential volume of wholesalers/retailers. Assist in generating the sales toolkit to enable the company’s sales strategy. This includes wholesale partner support documents, FAQs, instructional assets, etc. Follow up on qualified leads, providing the necessary information to close the sale. Maintaining positive business relationships to ensure future sales with existing customers.   Desired Qualifications and Traits: 2+ years experience in the coffee or hospitality industry is not required but is good to have. 2+ years experience in commercial sales across geographical markets is a plus. Adept in public speaking and delivering presentations to small and large groups. Strong communication skills, both written and verbal in English with proficiency in other languages a plus. Independent, creative problem solver, who is able to think outside the box. Strong negotiation, networking, prospecting, presentation, closing, and persuasion skills. Able to organise day to day work for maximum efficiency and productivity.   For interested candidates, please send an email to careers[at]drinkmorning.com with your CV and a cover letter. Qualified candidates will be contacted by our team.

Company Introduction  Jenfi provides non-dilutive revenue-based growth capital to businesses in Asia.   Small businesses in Asia are highly “bankable” yet over 50% are unable to obtain a loan. The simple reason boils down to economics. Jenfi solves this problem by providing an automated digital platform to help business owners finance their growth. The Jenfi platform utilizes revenue and alternative data via various data integrations to underwrite businesses quickly. A typical borrower, such as an ecommerce merchant, simply connects their accounts, eg. Stripe and Facebook advertising account, to get an immediate offer for growth funding. The borrower can choose repayment options that are tied to a percentage of their future sales.  Jenfi launched in 2019 and is co-founded by Jeffrey Liu (co-founder of GuavaPass) and Justin (CTO of GuavaPass). The company is backed by Y Combinator.  Job Description  This is an incredible and unique opportunity to grow your sales career in a high growth startup. We are looking for a Sales Development Representative (SDR) who will be responsible for developing a robust sales pipeline, responding to inbound inquiries and increasing our outbound activity. Your primary focus will be to own the backbone of the sales process and set up our clients and partners for success.  Responsibilities Prospect into different accounts / industries and identify new opportunities Respond to and maintain a high conversion rate from inbound leads Present and clearly articulate Jenfi’s value proposition to companies Report, manage and track sales activities through a CRM platform Play an active role in the creation and iteration of sales processes Identify target accounts for new outbound sales and marketing campaigns Meet and exceed the opportunity and revenue target quotas   Introduce and onboard partners onto the Jenfi platform and ecosystem  Skills Ability to adapt and thrive in a start-up environment Excellent interpersonal communication skills (verbal & written) Highly organised and disciplined Ability to manage time and multiple different tasks effectively under a high pressure environment Communicate effectively with all levels of executives within an organisation Familiarity with CRM and sales tools Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office, specifically Powerpoint and Excel  Experience Consistent track record of exceeding quota Bachelor’s degree required

Step into the future - together with us! Bertschi Group is a market leader in the logistics industry, specializing in intermodal services for the chemical industry. Headquartered in Switzerland, we are present with 3,150 Bertschi employees in 38 countries worldwide. Every day we work to provide the most innovative and sustainable logistics solutions for our global customers.  We are looking for a Sales Manager based in Bertschi Global Office Singapore.  The ideal candidate is a motivated, well-organized individual who has a deep understanding of prospecting and developing strong relationships with customers. You must have an extensive knowledge of ISOtanks market within SEASia including Singapore.  Role and responsibilities: ISOTank marketing & sales SEAsia with direct customers including in Singapore New customers’ development in SEAsia including Singapore. Managing existing customers base in Singapore Assisting the General Manager with tenders costing Procurement of ocean freight within the region Establishing competitive cost structure with suppliers/subcontractors in coordination with Technical Manager (depots, hauliers etc) within the region Management of the agents within the region  Interested? Please send your applications to shawn.ng@bertschi.com.  To learn more about Bertschi Group, visit our website: https://www.bertschi.com/
